Changing issue type from "Test" to "Bug" with component "Test". (Issue type "Test" is described as "A new unit, integration or system test.")

Although statementJdbc20 is a canon based test, parts of it use assertions:

// verify that table was not created
try

{ rs = stmt.executeQuery("select * from trash"); System.out.println("select from trash expected to fail"); }

catch (SQLException e)

{ BaseJDBCTestCase.assertSQLState("42X05", e); }

We could fix the failures by using BaseJDBCTestCase.assertSQLState() in more of the test cases.
The attached patch replaces three exception dumps with asserts and fixes the test in my environment.

Using assertSQLState seems quite reasonable.

However, instead of adding

+ System.out.println("setFetchSize(-1000) expected to fail");

does it work to instead say

+ fail("setFetchSize(-1000) expected to fail");

Or am I getting confused between the old harness and the new JUnit style here?

You're right, calling junit.framework.Assert.fail() should also work. The only difference is that it will stop the test, whereas with System.out.println() the test continues after the failure. But since the test is not yet a JUnit test, I'm not sure we should add to many of the JUnit constructs. I think assertSQLState() makes sense since it helps us work around a problem with canon based tests. I don't think using fail() gives us anything more than println() in this test, though.
